  • SEARCH: 
 

Package architecture

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    P
    Interface describing either an equation or an attestation.
    Statement
    This is simply the interface to be implemented by Proof and Attest.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Action
    Objects describing an action that a component can perform.
    Architecture
    Objects describing an architecture as a whole with all its components, relations properties, and so on.
    Attest
    Objects describing attestations of equations or proofs.
    Component
    Objects that describe a component in an architecture with all its actions and equations, and so on.
    Deduction
    Objects that model a deduction a component can make.
    DeductionCapability
    Objects that describe what a certain component is capable of deducing.
    Dep
    Objects that represent Dependence Relations.
    DependenceRelation
    Objects that map a dependence relation to a component.
    Equation
    Objects that represent equations as in a=b, a<b, etc.
    Proof
    Objects describing proofs that are linked to a component and contain either attestations or equations (or both).
    Term
    Object describes a term containing more terms and/or atoms.
    Trust
    Objects that describe a trust relation between two components.
    Variable
    Objects representing variables.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Action.ActionType
    All possible actions that a component can perform.
    Deduction.Type
    The type of deduction (e.g., transitivity).
    Equation.Relation
    Type of relations between two terms like equality or less than.
    Equation.Type
    Type of equations: simple relations like 'a=b', or conjunctions like 'a=b and c<d'.
    Term.Operator
    The explicit binary operators (elementary arithmetic operators or functions).
    Term.OperatorType
    The type of operator unary/binary/tertiary.
    Term.TermType
    The type of term (atom or composition).
